BANG JAM

An interactive and dynamic speaking competition testing quick thinking, accuracy, and fluency on random topics.

About the Event

  • Bang Jam is an interactive and dynamic speaking competition designed to test participants' quick thinking, accuracy, and fluency on random topics.
  • This event encourages spontaneity and speaking skills, providing participants with an engaging and challenging experience.

Event Details

  • Round Structure: Each round features four participants.
  • Judging Panel: Each participant is assigned a judge to monitor their performance, and a main judge oversees the round.
  • Topic Selection: The main judge provides a random topic for each round.

Rules & Regulations

  • Pressing the Bell: When the main judge announces the topic, participants press a bell to signify their readiness. The first to press the bell begins speaking.
  • Speaking Errors:
    • Allowed Objections: If the speaker makes any of the following errors, other participants may raise objections:
      • Late Start: Delayed speaking after pressing the bell.
      • Grammatical Errors: Language misuse or incorrect grammar.
      • Off-Topic: Speaking on irrelevant points.
      • Repetition: Overuse of the same words or phrases.
    • Objection Process: The assigned judge validates objections. If valid, the participant who raised the objection takes over speaking.
    • Timer Resumption: If a participant is interrupted due to a valid objection, their timer will resume from the point they left off if they resume speaking.
  • Winning Criteria: The first participant to speak continuously for one uninterrupted minute on the given topic wins the round.

Judging Criteria

  • Error Monitoring: Judges validate raised objections based on the above-listed errors.
  • Timing: Continuity in speaking without a valid objection for one minute results in a win.
  • Decision Finality: Judges' decisions are final.
  • Participation Limit: A maximum of 2 participants per college can participate in this event.
